text.p:
Recently we have demonstrated that nonexponential long-time decay of exciton recombination appears
in ensembles of indirect band gap InAlAs/AlAs QDs with a type I band gap alignment as a result of summing a
lot of single-exponential curves [1]. It takes place when the excitons with different recombination rates
(described by distribution function of exciton lifetimes G(τ R )), localized in the QDs of different size, shape and
composition emit at the same wavelength. Here we study the excitons recombination dynamics in such QDs.

text.p:
Here C is a constant, and τ 0 characterizes a maximum of the distribution of the exciton lifetimes. γ is a
parameter, which characterizes the width of the G(τ R )
distribution. Momentum conservation law restricts radiative
recombination of the exciton in indirect band gap QDs, since a
difference in the momenta of indirect exciton and photon should
be scattered. As it has been recently shown the main channel of
the momentum loss at the exciton recombination in the
InAlAs/AlAs QDs is the scattering at heterointerface QD/matrix
[2]. Recovery of the G(τ R ) distribution functions for the
ensembles of InAlAs/AlAs QDs with different sizes and
sharpness of the heterointerface allows us to demonstrate that
lifetime of indirect in the momentum space exciton in the QDs
depends mainly on the sharpness of heterointerface, while its
dependence from the QDs size is much smaller. In well
agreement with these experimental data the theoretical
estimation demonstrates that the lifetime of indirect in
momentum space exciton has exponential dependence from the
thickness d of the diffused interface InAlAs layer at
heterointerface QD/matrix:
